column5: How do you guys put them on your hooks to maximize their life?  Sometimes I'll hook them on and they dissipate the first cast.   I go through alot of roe bags  Gotta stop somewhere on my way to the ole fishin' hole to pick up some bags.
You want to hook them right under the knot...  Also, if you have a bag with 4-5 eggs, make sure you puncture one when putting it on the hook.  All that gooey nastiness is a great attractant.
Thanks Bill  I will try that tonight.. Hopefully we can hook into some fish.  Bigger roe bags at night right?
Bag size is really dependent on water clarity....  If it's clear you'll wanna downsize some..  But make sure they are milking, every little bit helps.
Okee Dokee..  Ive got a bunch of stuff to throw at them tonight...  Roe, Pink Worms.. spinners.. spoons...  I shall prevail!
I use a EGG LOOP knot. Have not lost a bag yet on this knot.
Got skunked.  Couldn't see the glowsticks on our floats due to the giant array of christmas lights reflecting off the water.  lol.
HO HO HO Holy Crap is that the best excuse you have???
I would use that one too... the way I am getting skunked on rainbows this year  Did u guys get rain there the last couple days?
yep lots of rain ...its time ! again
Yeah.  Is there a better technique to fish at night with Roe bags?  Wouldnt the bags be hard to see?

These are fish   Don't think to hard about it...  How much light do you think penetrates into the water during the day time, especially if it's a bit dirty?  Fish have no problem chasing bait/eating roe bags at night...
